description: In an episode from five years ago, the singer performs while suspended in midair, much like Sunday's half time show.
title: 'The Simpsons' predicted Lady Gaga's performance
title_page: Super Bowl 2017: 'The Simpsons' predicted Lady Gaga's performance
text:
The supremacy of â€œThe Simpsonsâ€ isnâ€™t really ever called into question to begin with, but after Super Bowl LI itâ€™s settled once and for all. Matt Groening and his writers can apparently predict the future.
Thereâ€™s been much talk recently about the fact that â€œThe Simpsonsâ€ predicted Donald Trumpâ€™s presidency almost 20 years ago. In a Season 11 episode titled â€œBart to the Future,â€ Lisa Simpson gives a press conference in which she alludes to President Trump by noting the budget crunch she believes he will leave the country in. That episode aired on March 19, 2000.
Well, the show writers have done it again, somehow predicting Lady Gagaâ€™s Super Bowl performance before it happened. Gagaâ€™s performance at Super Bowl LI in Houston, Texas was incredible â€” but Simpson Gaga did it first! In a â€œSimpsonsâ€ episode from five years ago titled â€œLisa Goes Gaga,â€ Lady Gaga performs in midair, suspended from a helicopter.
Additionally, the sky in the â€œSimpsonsâ€ episodes is lit up with a cowboy hat light design, very similar to what the real Lady Gaga did during her performance. You can watch the clip over at FXX.
Twitter was quick to jump on the comparison.
